alert.note: Alert for Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Washington; Western Addison (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 3:44PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Addison, southeastern Chittenden and west central Washington Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 344 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Buels Gore, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Huntington, Bristol, Duxbury, Waterbury Village, Waterbury, Fayston, Starksboro, Buels Gore, Middlesex, Monkton, Lincoln, Moretown, Bolton, Warren, Waterbury Center, North Moretown, West Lincoln, Huntington Center, South Duxbury, and South Starksboro. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 60 and 69. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Washington; Western Addison
